As we continue to celebrate Pride Month, Equality Day provides us with an opportunity to remember events that changed LGBTQI+ Americans‚Äô lives for the better.

Obergefell v. Hodges (June 26, 2015). üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

Eight years ago, the Court ruled on June 26 that same-sex couples have a constitutional right to marry, providing same-sex couples the ability to get married in every state in the US.

US v. Windsor (June 26, 2013).üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

10 years ago, on June 26, the Court overturned Section 3 of the discriminatory Defense of Marriage Act & ruled that same-sex couples legally married under state law deserve all of the rights and benefits provided by marriage under federal law.

Lawrence v. Texas (June 26, 2003) üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

20 years ago, the Court ruled on June 26 that states could no longer criminalize the private consensual sexual conduct between two people of the same sex, invalidating ‚Äúanti-sodomy‚Äù laws across the country.
